intro: Erythrophleum letestui, commonly known as the African ebony, is a tropical tree native to central and western Africa. It is characterized by its dark, dense wood that is highly valued for its strength and durability. The plant has compound leaves with alternate arrangement and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a legume pod containing several dark brown seeds. The tree plays an important ecological role in its native habitats and is also cultivated for its timber and ornamental value.
